intro: Galium mollugo var. hosmariense, commonly known as the Hosmariense bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing, herbaceous perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features slender, creeping stems that are often covered in fine, white hairs. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in dense, rounded inflorescences, and it produces small, three-lobed berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. This variant is native to specific regions in southern Europe and is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
